page.title: 07Ferryman at Threave Castle
page.content: I arrive at the Castle at 9.30 am. I bring the boat out of the shed and check the engine. If everything is all right I fill it up with petrol. The next thing I do is to take the boat across to the island so that I can sweep the Castle floors before the visitors start coming. Once I have finished the floors I go outside and see if there are any tourists wanting to come across to the Castle. If no-one is standing at the steps I have a look and see if anyone is coming down the path from the farm, Kelton Mains (which is 0.5 mile away). If I can see any people coming I take the boat across and wait for them. If no-one is coming I help Mr Welsh (the castle guide) cut the grass which could take 5 days to finish. If the weather is good we have lots of tourists visiting the Castle.
